alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 2:20AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley affecting Humboldt County. .Snowmelt will slow through Friday but increased flows are expected to continue through the weekend. For the Martin Creek...including Paradise Valley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Minor flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:55 AM PDT Thursday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:55 AM PDT Thursday was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is likely to remain in minor flood stage for at least a few more hours this morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.5 feet on 01/21/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Martin Creek Paradise Valle 5.5 5.7 Thu 1 am PDT 6.3 5.9 6.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
